thread.title: 2015 girls track | Western Branch at the top
thread.title_full: 2015 girls track preview | Western Branch at the top | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: Larry Rubama
title: 2015 girls track | Western Branch at the top
text:
FIVE ATHLETES YOU SHOULD KNOW Brandee’ Johnson, Nansemond River: Won the 200 meters and 300 hurdles to help lead Nansemond River to the 2014 4A state outdoor title and was The Virginian-Pilot’s Female Athlete of the Year.
Milan Parks, Western Branch: Dominated at the state indoor meet as she won the 55 meters (7.03), 55 hurdles (7.96) and long jump (19-61/2) to help the Bruins successfully defend their Group 6A state indoor track title.
Destiny Ward, Oscar Smith: Finished second in the 500, third in the 300 and sixth in the triple jump at the 6A state indoor meet.
Kara Lyles, Nansemond River: Won the state indoor long jump and 500 meters, was second in the high jump and fourth in the 55 meters.
Lauryn Ghee, Grassfield: Won the state indoor 300, placed second in the 55 and third in the high jump.
STORYLINES
GROUP 6A
In the Coastal Conference ...
First Colonial coach Jaton Hines said the team will be built around the field events, including pole vaulter Allie Ingraham and jumpers Lakyra Snowden and Victoria Williams. He also has three throwers over 35 feet in the shot put led by thrower Phontavia Sawyer, who finished runner-up in the shot put at the indoor state meet.
In the Monitor-Merrimac Conference ...
Grassfield finished runner-up to Western Branch at the 6A state indoor meet. The Grizzlies are led by sophomore Lauryn Ghee, who is one of the nation’s top sprinters. Coach Leroy Harper said he has a talented young group of girls who have a lot potential and “are already ready to compete for a state title.” The Grizzlies will have one of the top 400 and 1,600 relays this season. Also watch for sprinters Felecia Hayes, Jade Smith, Kori-Madisyn Blount, Destiny Copeland and Akoya Bines. ... Oscar Smith is led by the 1-2 punch of Destiny Ward and Alexis Woodley. The Tigers also have sprinters Takiara Askew and Shaytorria Skinner, and jumpers Janelle Cheatham, Ariana Labat and Shakeria Johnson.
___
GROUP 5A
In the Atlantic Conference ...
Princess Anne is led by distance runner Doria Martingayle, jumper Victoria Gibson and thrower Kayla Brown. Martingayle and Brown were all-state last spring. Martingayle was third in the 3,200 and Brown was seventh in the discus. ... Green Run is led by Breanna Anderson, CeeAsha Gist, Iyana Preston and LeDiamond Davis in the jumps, sprints and relays.
In the PenSouth Conference ...
Hickory has a very strong team led by distance runners Kailin Gyuricsko, Jodi Tolarchyk, Hannah Glasgow, Madisyn VanGorder and Kate Miller, who finished third in the 1,000 meters at the 5A state indoor meet. The Hawks, who won the PenSouth Conference indoor title, also have thrower Rachel Murray.
___
In private schools ...
Norfolk Academy will be deep again across the board in all events. The top returning standouts are Tyler Bannister, Ellie Rudolph and Marika Livingston. All three athletes compete in the sprints, hurdles and jumps. Others to watch are distance runner Julia Lambert, hurler/jumper Anna Brush and sprinters Tai Jeffers, Fran Mercer and Olivia Newsome.
Larry Rubama, 757-446-2273 or larry.rubama@pilotonline.com , Twitter: @LHRubama
 3 photos: Western Branch's Milan Parks takes the baton from Chaunise Warrior during the 800-meter relay at the Group 6A state indoor track championships at Boo Williams Sportsplex in Hampton on Tuesday, March 10, 2015. (L. Todd Spencer 3 TOP TEAMS IN SOUTH HAMPTON ROADS 1. Western Branch: Bruins are led by sprinters Milan Parks, Faith Ross and Funlayo Oluwole.
2. Nansemond River: Warriors won the 4A state indoor team title and are the defending outdoor champs.
3. Grassfield: Grizzlies finished runner-up at the 6A state indoor meet.
4. Oscar Smith: Tigers are young but talented and finished eighth at 6A state indoor meet.
5. Great Bridge: Wildcats have sprinters, throwers and distance runners to compete in 5A.
Posted to : Sports
